revised_title: Thermal Conductivity Measurements of Lunar Core Samples: A New Technique
tldr: The authors developed a new technique for measuring the thermal conductivity of lunar core samples by heating them radiatively from the outside and measuring the temperature at the surface of the core tube. They derived a solution for the thermal conduction equation of a composite circular cylinder, which provides a theoretical basis for this technique. The method preserves the samples and offers insights into the understanding of heat transportation mechanisms in the lunar regolith.
